string.value: FATHER|Wake up, lazybones! I've been waiting for an hour to tell you something very important, and you're sleeping like a groundhog again...
Good morning to you, too. What are you nervous about?
FATHER|Okay, cool it. There you go. Today's a big day in your life. You've always been a great help to me, and you've learned a lot from me... So, I've decided it's time for you to come of age.
FATHER|Now you're a real man and you can do whatever you want, even start a family... But, of course, it's better to ask permission first.
Is this the day?! I thought I was going to be marinated on this farm until I was old!
I mean, I wanted to say, thank you very much, I'll try to live up to the trust you put in me, sir!
FATHER|You're being sarcastic again, and I have so much to say to you...
What, I can get in right now and go wherever I want?
FATHER|Well, if you're in such a hurry to drive, go to Sowth and give Sergo this package. We'll talk when you get back.
Ho-oo-ray!!! I'll be right back! Take care, old man!
All right, all right, here's the money, just don't touch me!
BANDIT FELIX|Okay, you got lucky this time. Next time stay out of my sight, or you won't get off that easy. Now get out of here!
LISA|Wait here while I finish my business.
LISA|Done. Let's move on.
LISA|Gosh, what a waste of time! I know he's around here somewhere! Are you sure we've been around all the settlements around here?
Yes, all the villages like you said. However, there is still one village left, Gloohoe.
LISA|So why are you messing with my head? How do I get there?
It's actually north of here over the mountains, not far at all, but there's no direct road. We'll have to go through Sowth...
LISA|This is where we part ways: I'm tired of following your wreck. Besides, where there is no road for you, my car will pass easily. You held up your part of the deal. Here's your money.
What was she looking for? It's time for me to go home, too. I'm going to find out what my father was so worried about.

BANDIT FELIX|There's our troublemaker. My sources tell me that you've become Lisa's assistant, and she's a generous girl... For a little contribution of 1000 coins you can continue your dirty business and even rely on our support.
Really? I don't have that much money! And who are you people anyway?
BANDIT FELIX|We're going to' sell your car for parts to compensate us the moral damage. Attack him!
BANDIT FELIX|We'll meet again, you fool! Mark my words: you will regret messing with Felix!
I will avenge my father's death!
BANDIT FELIX|Bah, all the familiar faces. Teach this insolent bastard a lesson!
Is that all you've got? Come out and fight like a man!!
BANDIT FELIX|The guy's pretty good... Where did he get that kind of weaponry? All right, you want to do something good - you do it yourself. Step aside.
Now you will die for all your crimes!
BANDIT FELIX|Wait, I haven't killed anyone in years. We had a deal with the locals! You're the one who broke into my house and started killing my people!
Only you would have the strength and cruelty to burn down an entire village!
BANDIT FELIX|Oh, so you're from Gloohoe! Believe me, it wasn't us, but some bandits from neighboring regions!
You are lying!
BANDIT FELIX|I swear on my father's grave! Ask your newfound friend Lisa. She saw everything.
How do you know?
BANDIT FELIX|That's what she told us. And then she ran off to the north. Towards Pesht.
Lisa... I feel she had something to do with all this... All right, Felix, I'll keep you alive. Go on your way. Just don't show your face around this lands again!
BANDIT FELIX|You won. But we will meet again, and I will be better prepared then.
So long!
DRUNKER PETRO|Great, we've shown these rascals who's boss here!
Oh god, father! What happened here? Who did it?
FATHER|Listen carefully. You are my adopted son. These are your real father's things. Find Ben The Throttle. He's an explorer. He can help... Son... don't let the hate... poison your... so... ul...
My life... What should I do next? After all, I have nobody left... and nothing... Only this letter...

LETTER | "...Son, if you are reading this letter, it means I couldn't go back and raise you myself. I know that Peter has brought you up nicely. I see you, so young and full of strength, and my heart is filled with tears..."

LETTER | "...I blame myself for not being around when you were growing up. And this is my terrible punishment. But you must know that I couldn't do it any other way. I have the task of a lifetime ahead of me..."

LETTER | "...Only by doing what I had planned I could calm down and feel like a human being again. If not... then I don't deserve to live. This letter is an apology. Forgive me if you can. You are always in my heart, son."

Is that all? No explanation... How can I forgive someone I never knew? There's nothing left for me to do here. I'm going to search for Ben. Whoever it is, I hope he can help me find myself. Maybe they've heard of him in Sowth?
Do you wish to leave this area?
I don't know where this road leads, so I'll stay here.
It's a strange place. I'd better stay away from here.

@ffffffff| History has not kept an exact record of the dark times immediately following the Catastrophe. All that is known is that people survived the poisoned air by wearing protective masks. This creation of an unknown inventor equaled everyone. The thin barrier that stood in the way of imminent death became a symbol of the new humanity. The masks united the people and gave them strength to fight for a place under the sun.|| New settlements emerged away from the old cities, which had become mass graves. Little by little, connections were formed between the disparate groups of survivors. Farmers, miners, traders - a return to simple activities was only beneficial to the people who had been left behind.|| But nothing can change the nature of man. There were those who retained the wisdom of the ages to share with the world. There were also those who chose destruction over creation.

@ffffffff| History has not kept an exact record of the dark times immediately following the Catastrophe. All that is known is that people survived the poisoned air by wearing protective masks. This creation of an unknown inventor equaled everyone. The thin barrier that stood in the way of imminent death became a symbol of the new humanity. The masks united the people and gave them strength to fight for a place under the sun.|| New settlements emerged away from the old cities, which had become mass graves. Little by little, connections were formed between the disparate groups of survivors. Farmers, miners, traders - a return to simple activities was only beneficial to the people who had been left behind.|| But nothing can change the nature of man. There were those who retained the wisdom of the ages to share with the world. There were also those who chose destruction over creation.
You have been in Gloohoe for too long, and you were killed along with all its inhabitants. Now you will never know the whole truth about you and this world.

The destruction of the Njeri outpost, the aliens from other worlds, unleashed the Oracle. The first thing he did was to take control of the orbital weaponry and launch a nuclear attack on Zarmek. When the source of the contamination was destroyed, many experienced a shock from which not all could recover.

The mysterious radiation was too deeply rooted in human nature. In an attempt to rectify the evil caused, the supercomputer slowly began to extend itself into all areas of human life. From its blueprints, numerous useful devices were rebuilt.

All sorts of robotic assistants were assigned to each survivor to help them with everything. The people, however, did not accept the change. Many gave up the Oracle's gifts and returned to simple activities. And increasingly, some regretted the disappearance of the voice that incessantly whispered of ascension.

For the first time in many years, peace has prevailed in Vaterland. The Brigade clan, who constantly terrorized the northern traders, has been completely destroyed, and the weapons found at their base are now used to protect their caravans.

The new mayor of Minin not only established oil supplies to all the surrounding villages, but also turned the city into the largest trading zone, where every free trader can profitably sell his goods.

Calm has returned to the Druid Grove. With the rescue of the rebels from Uluk, the Druids were able to prevent the assassination of the Main Druid and completely suppress the rebellion of the Children of Iron. Now all the towns in the Grove live in harmony and the steel monsters no longer trouble anyone.

After the victory of the anti-militarist movement, the CIT and CD stopped their existence. Now Argen and Librium are united under the Union of Liberated Countries - a faction created by anti-militarist leaders after the victory in the war.
It is too early to tell, but it is all but certain that the Union of Liberated Countries will be the first faction to make such significant progress in governing the country.

As for the main character, he can only be envied. Tired of the eternal road and saving of the world, he settled down in Gugulino with Lisa and going to live the rest of his life in peace and happiness. But have his adventures ended there? Well, we'll see.

Despite the closing of the borders and a considerable military force, the northern merchants eventually lost the war with the fishermen and returned back to the Vatherland. Peace and tranquility now returned to Hel.

With outside help, the people of Lidencloud managed to fight off the Adepts and leave these troubled lands in time. They successfully made it to Le Canada and started a new life there, while the Adepts returned to their lands and never attacked anyone again.
Despite all the bandits' attempts to take over the Sowth, it stood firm. The timely help of one brave and concerned traveler literally saved the entire Krai.
After such a powerful repulse, the bandits dropped all attempts to occupy the town and returned to robbery and looting, doing which is becoming more and more difficult every day.
||@FF000000ÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀ@FFFFA600"Targem Games"
||@FF000000ÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀ@FFFFFFFFin cooperation with @FFFFA600"Buka" @FFFFFFFFPublishing House
|@FF000000ÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀÀ@FFFFA600Ex Machina / Hard Truck Apocalypse||@FF000000ÀÀÀÀÀIÀÀÀÀÀAIÀÀÀÀ@FFFFFFFFImproved Storyline v1.1
It seems that this is the last one... Now the people of the Sowth can now breathe a sigh of relief.
Would you like to disable Mr. Hat? |("Yes" is recommended if this is your first time playing the mod)
Improved Storyline v1.1||Before starting the game, it is highly recommended to read the mod manual.|@00FFFFFFA
Password for the bonus ending: K**************|For more information, read the mod's manual.
Can you believe it? It was only yesterday that he was running from city to city, trying to figure out what was going on. Today he is already in the desert... How fast time flies...
SERGO|"Time flies", you say? It's funny to hear that from you.
Why are you still here?
SERGO|Don't worry, I can get to the Overlord before him.
I wish I could believe it. There's too much at stake. You remember what you shouldn't tell him about, don't you?
SERGO|Yes, I do.
Great. I hope he'll make the right choice.
I don't think there's any point in showing Gloohoe to Lisa. The man she's looking for can not be there anyway.
What the hell...
FATHER|Son, you're taking a long time. Did Sergo accept the parsel? Were there any difficulties on the way?
No... I don't want to see you! Get gone! You're dead!
Password for the bonus ending: *4*************|For more information, read the mod's manual.

You skip credits - you don't get a password.
Do you want to travel to Hel immediately?
I think he was talking about this house. Well, it's not much, but it'll do for a while.
LISA|If we renew it's exterior, it'll be as good as new. But it'd be better to clean it inside first...
LISA|Look, we can demolish this room here and move the furniture from there...
LISA|And then we can build another window here, and then it will be just perfect...
Yeah, I guess that's the life I've always dreamed of.
Wow... What did he mix in there? All right, well, I need to focus... Damn, this is gonna be harder than I thought. Well, Godspeed!
